title: Biden’s Illegal, Wrongheaded Eviction Ban
sub_head: It is an unconstitutional ‘taking’ of the landlord’s property.
body:
I join the editorial board in befuddlement at “The Rental Evictions Fiasco” (Aug. 2). When the federal government requires a landlord to give away a rental unit to a tenant, it is an unconstitutional “taking” of the landlord’s property. At a minimum, landlords should be able to apply directly for compensation from the $43 billion of undistributed rental relief funds appropriated by Congress. This really isn’t that complicated.
Landlords have every incentive to work with tenants to accommodate temporary financial issues. Which landlord would evict a good, longstanding tenant for a delay in paying a few months rent during a pandemic? A problem tenant who has no intention of ever paying the rent is a different kettle of fish. A return to individual choice and accountability would be good for our country.
Chad King
Bluffton, S.C.
